description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is
experiencing Loss Of Signal. Bellcore Document
TA-NWT-000253 Section 6.3.1.1.1 states that... A SONET
NE shall declare a LOS failure when the LOS defect
persists for 2.5 (+- .5) seconds, or when a LOS defect
is present and the criteria for LOF failure
declaration have been met.

event.Summary: Loss of signal detected on port $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Fore-Sonet-Ext-MIB::foreSonetLOSDetected IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE Fore-TrapLog-MIB::trapLogIndex i 9999

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: The sequence number of this trap occurence. This
entry uniquely identifies an entry in the trapLogTable
variables.name: Fore-TrapLog-MIB::trapLogIndex

description: This trap indicates that the LOS condition identified
by trap foreSonetLOSDetected has been cleared.

event.Summary: Loss of signal cleared on port $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Fore-Sonet-Ext-MIB::foreSonetLOSCleared IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE Fore-TrapLog-MIB::trapLogIndex i 9999

variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: The sequence number of this trap occurence. This
entry uniquely identifies an entry in the trapLogTable
variables.name: Fore-TrapLog-MIB::trapLogIndex

description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is
receiving and errored C2 Path Label byte. Reference
Bellcore Document TA-NWT-000253 Section 3.3.2.3 and
6.3.1.1.8 the Path Label (C2) byte should have the
value 0x13 or 0x01.

event.Summary: C2 Path Label byte error detected on port $v2

description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is
experiencing Loss Of Frame (LOF) failure. An LOF
failure is declared when the LOF defect persists fore
a period of 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds, except when an LOS
defect or failure is present.

event.Summary: Loss of Frame failure detected on port $v2

entry uniquely identifies an entry in the trapLogTable
variables.name: Fore-TrapLog-MIB::trapLogIndex

description: This trap indicates that the Path RDI failure
identified by trap foreSonetPathRDIDetected has been
cleared. The Path RDI failure is cleared when no Path
RDI defects are detected for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

event.Summary: Path Remote Defect Indication failure cleared on port $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Fore-Sonet-Ext-MIB::foreSonetPathRDICleared IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE Fore-TrapLog-MIB::trapLogIndex i 9999

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: The sequence number of this trap occurence. This
entry uniquely identifies an entry in the trapLogTable
variables.name: Fore-TrapLog-MIB::trapLogIndex

description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET path
is experiencing a PDI-P ( Path Defect Indication)
condition. A PDI-P indication is signalled by
a value in the C2 ( path label ) byte in the range
0xe0..0xfc.

event.Summary: Path Defect Indication failure detected on port $v2

variables.name: Fore-TrapLog-MIB::trapLogIndex

description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is
experiencing Bit Interleaved Parity (BIP) errors. A
Line BIP failure is declared when the Line BIP defect
persists for a period of 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

event.Summary: Line Bit Interleaved Parity failure detected on port $v2

description: This trap indicates that the specified Sonet virtual
tributary is receiving an AIS indication from the far
end. An AIS-V failure is declared when the AIS-V defect
persists for 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

event.Summary: Alarm Indication Signal failure detected on port $v2
